description.narrative:
In Sub Saharan Africa the Data Center market is nascent, forcing government and corporations, especially financial institutions, to build their own facilities in-house. When compared to in-house facilities, data centers offer improved energy efficiency, a high level of reliability and redundancy, the capability to host more sophisticated IT services and solutions and are often much more cost effective.
IFC's investment will expand the availability of high quality/high availability IT infrastructure which is, in turn, needed for IT systems, business continuity and disaster recovery services. This, in turn, would improve private sector connectivity and public sector competitiveness. The Project will help provide cost-efficient and energy-efficient IT infrastructure and services, the lack of which is a major constraint to doing business in the region, including in South Africa.

Teraco Data Environments (Pty) Limited (Teraco or the Company) operates vendor neutral data centers in South Africa large, energy efficient information and communication technology (ICT) infrastructure facilities whereby customers can locate ICT equipment to connect to any of numerous data carriers (Internet Service Providers) in an open market environment. The Company was founded in 2007 and operates South Africas first carrier and vendor neutral data center, located just outside of Cape Towns business district, and has recently opened a second data center in the Johannesburg metropolitan area.
Teraco is raising capital to expand in South Africa and develop plans for international expansion into Sub-Saharan Africa. Proceeds would be invested in three new facilities, i) a second data center in Cape Town, ii) second and third phases of its Johannesburg facility, and iii) a new data center in Durban, another major business hub in the country. Additionally, as those facilities come on line, Teraco would use the remaining funds to develop detailed plans for their international expansion.
The expansion of capacity in Cape Town and Johannesburg, and new facility in Durban, would complete Teracos national data center footprint, offering customers state-of-the-art ICT infrastructure in South Africas main business conurbations.
